entries.name: NoParam
entries.desc:
represents VT_ERROR variant with DISP_E_PARAMNOTFOUND. This constants is
used for not specified parameter.
fso = WIN32OLE.new("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
fso.openTextFile(filename, WIN32OLE_VARIANT::NoParam, false)

entries.name: Nothing
entries.desc:
represents Nothing of VB.NET or
VB.

entries.name: array(ary, vt)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns Ruby object wrapping OLE variant whose variant type is VT_ARRAY. The first argument should be Array object which specifies dimensions and each size of dimensions of OLE array. The second argument specifies variant type of the element of OLE array.

entries.name: new(val, vartype) #=> WIN32OLE_VARIANT object.click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns Ruby object wrapping OLE variant. The first argument specifies Ruby object to convert OLE variant variable. The second argument specifies VARIANT type. In some situation, you need the WIN32OLE_VARIANT object to pass OLE method

entries.name: WIN32OLE_VARIANT[i,j,...] #=> element of OLE array.click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the element of WIN32OLE_VARIANT object(OLE array). This method is available only when the variant type of WIN32OLE_VARIANT object is VT_ARRAY.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_VARIANT[i,j,...] = val #=> set the element of OLE arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Set the element of WIN32OLE_VARIANT object(OLE array) to val. This method is available only when the variant type of WIN32OLE_VARIANT object is VT_ARRAY.

entries.name: value #=> Ruby object.click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns Ruby object value from OLE variant.

entries.name: value = val #=> set WIN32OLE_VARIANT value to val.click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets variant value to val. If the val type does not match variant value type(vartype), then val is changed to match variant value type(vartype) before setting val. This method is not available when vartype is VT_ARRAY(except VT_UI1|VT_ARRAY). If the vartype is VT_UI1|VT_ARRAY, the val should be String object.

entries.name: vartype #=> OLE variant type.click to toggle source
